dc_title_s: Maps to accompany papers on journeys in Eastern China, by G. J. Morrison, M.I.C.E., 1878
dc_description_s: Primary section of map shows Shandong, Hebei, Henan, Jiangsu, and Anhui. Ancillary section shows parts of Hubei, Hunan, Jiangxi, and Guangdong. "The course of the Yellow River between Liu Yuan Kow and Lo Kow and that of the Grand Canal from the Yang Tsze Kiang to Tai Erh Chwang have been inserted from surveys made by Mr. Morrison." Relief shown by hachures. Yellow River depth shown by soundings. Heights of embankments along Yellow River are shown. Old course of Yellow River and sites of former lakes are shown. From: Proceedings of the Royal Geographical Society and monthly record of geography. Vol. 2 (1880), no. 3, pp. 145-66; held in Firestone Library. Call number: G7 .J6873
